<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Spellshot Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3267) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Class" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=397" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 140</row>

**Archetype** [Spellshot](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=122)

**Prerequisites**
way of the spellshot

</column>

---

You've steeped yourself in magic and gunplay to the extent that you can conjure bullets from thin air, using a rudimentary knowledge of arcane theory to create a temporary piece of ammunition. You gain the Conjure Bullet action.

 **Conjure Bullet** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** You conjure an ordinary level-0 bolt or bullet out of thin air and then immediately Interact to load it into your weapon. If the bolt or bullet isn't fired before the end of your turn, the effect is wasted.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat other than Beast Gunner Dedication until you've gained two other feats from the spellshot or beast gunner archetypes.

<title level="2">Spellshot Dedication leads to...</title>
[Black Powder Embodiment](/Feats.aspx?ID=3271), [Call Gun](/Feats.aspx?ID=3269), [Fulminating Shot](/Feats.aspx?ID=3268), [Phase Bullet](/Feats.aspx?ID=3270)
name: Spellshot Dedication
